title: some of Firefox’s security features may offer less protection on your current operating system
content:
After install KUbuntu 24.10, I've uninstalled Firefox snap and add the mozilla repository for installing Firefox with apt.

Firefox is installed, but appears the message "some of Firefox’s security features may offer less protection on your current operating system". Reading the link provided in the message, I've created the firefox-local file on /etc/apparmor.d/, but continues with the same error. The Firefox path used is /usr/lib/firefox.

creator: onlythevee1

title: Missing Favicons in Bookmar Toolbar (Linux Mint)
content: Have been using Firefox 133.03 on Mint 22 Cinnamon for a couple of weeks now, but I have a number of randomly missing favicons in my bookmark toolbar. I have extensively googled the issue and tried pretty much all the remedies I could find: just click on the place holder icon to refresh, delete the bookmark and place it again, use the Checkmark extension, check the integrity of the favicon DB, delete the favicon and places.sqlite files, clear the cache. Doing these things repeatedly and repeatedly restarting Firefox, I could claw back a number of my icons, but now things have stalled and there a quite a few holdouts that refuse to update. I'm also using Firefox on Windows without these issues. Would appreciate some hints as to how to further troubleshoot this.
creator: onkel98

title: Firefox will not play any audio
content: Hi! i opened youtube to watch some videos, but the audio wouldn't play. i checked the volume mixer and firefox isn't putting out any sound at all. I tried playing audio on other sites like netflix and tiktok, but the issue is the same there. it doesn't seem like firefox is registering that any audio is playing, as the little speaker icon does not show up when i hover over the tab. i thought it might have been an issue with my headset but the speakers won't play any sound either. i've tried running firefox in troubleshoot mode but that didn't do anything (i don't really know what to do in that mode, but hey, i figured i'd at least try) Also, i opened the same sites in microsoft edge, and they play the audio just fine. I'd rather not have to use edge for too long though, so any help is appreciated :)

title: Thumbnail Preview image in save window for webp files
content:
Usually if I want to save an image, I can go into save and go to the directory I want to save the file, and all of the files there will show. Then if I want to confirm that the file I'm saving is not a duplicate, I can click on the files in the list and see a thumbnail on the right hand side.

This works for JPG and PNG. But not for Webp.

Is there a way to activate this for Webp?

I've attached an image of what I get with JPG and PNG files. The image on the right is missing with WebP.

title: Suspicious sign in
content:
Hi there, on Monday on 3:43 and 4:41 o clock I got two emails reading „Your Mozilla account was used to sign in“. I didnt Login by myself at this Point, also was not using Firefox for some time.

The E-Mails seemed legit, but I went directly to the Mozilla Website by Browser without clicking links in the emails.

In the recent activity the Login attempts were visible. There were no unknown devices connected.

At 8:54 I changed my Password and activated 2FA.

Can you tell if someone truly accessed my account? Or did the person just try?

Thanks, Daniel
